alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 8:14AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, northeastern Hancock and southeastern Pearl River Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 814 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kiln, or 7 miles northwest of Diamondhead, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Diamondhead, Saucier, Kiln, Lyman and Shoreline Park. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 10 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison
